[Home](./index.md) &gt; [photo-dir-to-json](./photo-dir-to-json.md) &gt; [PhotoResizeParams](./photo-dir-to-json.photoresizeparams.md)

## PhotoResizeParams interface

Configuration needed when performing a photo resize.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface PhotoResizeParams 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [dir](./photo-dir-to-json.photoresizeparams.dir.md) |  | string | The directory to save the resized photo. The photo is saved with the same filename. \*\*WARNING:\*\* existing files are overwritten. |
|  [largeSideMax](./photo-dir-to-json.photoresizeparams.largesidemax.md) |  | number | The maximum size in pixels for the \*longest\* side of the photo. The height for portrait photos and width for landscape. Aspect ratio is always preserved. |
|  [quality?](./photo-dir-to-json.photoresizeparams.quality.md) |  | number | _(Optional)_ Integer from 1-100, default 80. Defines the output quality of saved images for JPG, WebP, and TIFF file types. |
|  [smallSideMax?](./photo-dir-to-json.photoresizeparams.smallsidemax.md) |  | number | <p>_(Optional)_ The maximum size in pixels for the \*shortest\* side of the photo. The width for portrait photos and height for landscape. Aspect ratio is always preserved.</p><p>If this is not defined, the photo is guaranteed to fit inside a square with sides <code>largeSideMax</code>. If defined, it must be a value smaller than <code>largeSideMax</code> to have any effect. The resulting photo will fit within the size of the rectangle specified by the large and small side maximums.</p> |
